result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher D. Pingley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Fail/Report to County Jail (<10 Days), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.425(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher D. Pingley

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def.  Constitutional rights explained to defendant.  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights. Def pleas guilty to amended charge; Nelson stipulates to a factual basis.   COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS. Court finds and adjudicates Def guilty of amended charge. Froelich and Nelson address sentencing. Court: orders time served, Def served 9 days in Dakota County on this matter. Appeal rights given to Def.

9:33 Defendant Christopher D. Pingley in court with attorney Liesl E Nelson.  Sean E Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Froelich: moves to amend to misd. jail to report. Has served that time. Nelson and Def agree. Froelich will file information today.   Court goes over Preliminary Questionnaire and Waiver form with Def.  Constitutional rights explained to defendant.  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights. Def waives his right to have a preliminary hearing. Court finds the Def probably commited a felony. Court grants motion and amends charge to misd.
Preliminary hearing on June 30, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Def voluntarily waives his 20 day time limit
records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

William H Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant has copy of complaint  Defendant waives reading of the complaint  Constitutional rights explained to defendant  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights.  Atty Nelson makes argument for signature bond.  NOT A VET.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 30, 2014 at 09:00 am.
